result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan A. Richert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:33 Defendant Morgan A. Richert in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: requests warrant quashed defendant failed to appear yesterday 6/20.  Court orders warrant quashed. Froelich: plead to count 1 poss. of methamphetamine, S/W 1 year no conditional jail time, conditions set by agent, costs. Attorney Amann agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. Attorney Amann adresses the court, requests expungment if probation is completed successfully.  Froelich: no objection to exupungment. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders: S/W 1 year, court costs $515.00 due over period of probation, DNA Sample and Surcharge, no possession or consumption of any alcohol or illegal drug, or anything more than the amount prescribed for prescription drugs, follow other terms and conditions set forth by agent.  Court: if probation is successfully completed, case may be expunged.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 11:48

10:59 Attorney T Gregory Amann in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by the defendant.  State requests bench warrant due to non appearance. Amann addresses. Court orders bench warrant.
Plea hearing on June 20, 2016 at 10:15 am.

02:19 Defendant Morgan A. Richert in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Defendant Morgan A. Richert in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: agreement has been reached requests case be set for plea. Parties agree.  Parties to see JA for plea date to be scheduled after defendant is released from custody in a couple of week but before June 10. 02:21
